Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: This class was a good addition to the class and helped me visualize the anatomy of the different systems we were learning about.
I learned to analyze vertebrate body plans.
How to use a microscope to analyze tissue and how to dissect several organisms.

The dissections were sometimes a bit confusing, and it was difficult to know if we were actually seeing all that we were supposed to be seeing. This could maybe be improved by having instructional throughout the dissection to make sure everyone is on the same page.
The strengths are getting to work with different species. Some of the labs could have used more structure.
The tests counted for way too much of the course, given that almost everyone got a 100% on the homeworks/labs. One missed question on a midterm meant a letter grade drop. Ouch.
Strengths include easy to follow lab manuals. Improvements: difficult to study for exams as most of what was done in class was identification and not learning about the systems in depth.
Yes, it was a fun lab with opportunity to work with great specimens.
